snippet: How Snapchat lessons from a younger colleague, whose job didn’t exist five years ago, stretched a New York Times editor professionally and personally....
abstract: New York Times reporter Phyllis Korkki recounts experience of learning Snapchat photo and video app from twenty-something mentor and fellow colleague Talya Minsberg; notes many companies are embracing reverse mentorships as ideal way to advance technological skills of older workers and address generational differences in workplace.
lead_paragraph: How Snapchat lessons from a younger colleague, whose job didn’t exist five years ago, stretched a New York Times editor professionally and personally.

headline.main: What Could I Possibly Learn From a Mentor Half My Age? Plenty
headline.print_headline: Schooled by a Mentor Half My Age
